intro: Zigadenus gramineus, commonly known as death camisole, is a toxic plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Melanthiaceae and is characterized by its grass-like foliage and showy, yellowish-green flowers. The plant contains potent alkaloids, such as cyclopamine, which can be lethal to humans and animals if ingested. It thrives in dry, open habitats and is often found in meadows and along roadsides. Due to its toxicity, it is important to avoid contact or consumption of any part of this plant.
